channel.title: Hyperion: No response from server, please try a different world
channel.description:
My friend is currently running a 317 Hyperion 2006 remake and he is getting this error when ever he tries to log onto a saved character file: No response from server, please try a different world... If you make a new character you do not receive this error message.
Can anyone help?

item.title: Hyperion: No response from server, please try a different world
item.dc:creator: @suitfruit12211 suitfruit12211
item.description:
@suitfruit12211 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:13, topic:539956”][quote author=suitfruit12211 link=topic=658808.msg4406559#msg4406559 date=1392161903]
I mean a character that was already backed up can not login and will get this error while any characters that have just been made wont.
[/quote]File saving/writing is broken, perhaps give snippets?[/quote]

I doubt this is the case since we have made 3 backups and every backup we have tried has the same issue.

Read full topic
item.source: Hyperion: No response from server, please try a different world

item.title: Hyperion: No response from server, please try a different world
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“suitfruit12211, post:10, topic:539956”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=658808.msg4406555#msg4406555 date=1392161058]
Try checking if the folder exists? to confirm if my speculation is the issue.
[/quote]

Well you see, it allows all non pre made characters to login, but not pre made.
When we compiled everything with eclipse no errors came up.
The character files should be in the right directory.[/quote]I don’t really understand what you mean by pre-made, elaborate please. Does this issue also persist if the ‘non pre made’ characters log out and in?

Read full topic
item.source: Hyperion: No response from server, please try a different world

Try checking if the folder exists? to confirm if my speculation is the issue.

The character files should be in the right directory.

item.title: Hyperion: No response from server, please try a different world
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

It’s probably caused by you not having the players save directory created by default - doubt it creates it.

Read full topic
item.source: Hyperion: No response from server, please try a different world

item.title: Hyperion: No response from server, please try a different world
item.dc:creator: @ixia ixia
item.description:
@ixia wrote:

[quote=“suitfruit12211, post:5, topic:539956”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=658808.msg4406342#msg4406342 date=1392088056]
Because it suppresses them by default.
[/quote]

Could you elaborate on this more?
One of my friends said it could be in the login protocols and said it might send the wrong opcodes.[/quote]
The server is not reading the char file properly so it cannot load it giving you the error.

Read full topic

Chances are it is unable to read the save file, check for any errors in the world loader

It doesnt come up with any errors.
